record_data.record_plain_text:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION
STATEMENT OF OPERATING CONDITIONS OF BOSTON GAS COMPANY PURSUANT TO BLANKET CERTIFICATE ISSUED IN DOCKET NO. CP92-188
This Statement of Operating Conditions ("Statement") sets forth how Boston Gas Company d/b/a National Grid ("Transporter") will provide transportation service on a non-discriminatory basis pursuant to Section 284.224 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission's ("Commission") rules and regulations. Boston Gas Company d/b/a National Grid ("Transporter"), a local gas distribution company in the State of Massachusetts, is the holder of a blanket certificate authorizing, inter alia, the transportation of gas under Subpart G of Part 284 of the Commission's regulations ("Part 284.224 Blanket Certificate"), issued in Docket No. CP92-188 by order dated February 2, 1995 in Boston Gas Co. et al., 70 FERC 61,122 (1995). This Statement describes the manner in which Transporter engages in firm and interruptible transportation services under its Part 284.224 Blanket Certificate for any eligible shipper. General Terms and Conditions of Service 1. Definitions a. The word "day" as used herein means a period of twenty-four (24) consecutive hours beginning and ending at 10:00 a.m. Eastern Clock Time (ECT). The date of a day shall be that of its beginning. b. The word "month" as used herein means the period commencing at 10:00 a.m. ECT on the first day of any calendar month and ending at 10:00 a.m. ECT on the first day of the next succeeding calendar month. c. The word "year" as used herein means a period of three hundred and sixty-five (365) consecutive days commencing and ending at 10:00 a.m. ECT, provided that any year which contains the date of February 29 shall consist of three hundred and sixty-six (366) consecutive days. d. The words "cubic foot of gas" as used herein mean the amount of gas contained in one cubic foot of space at a pressure of 14.73 pounds per square inch absolute ("psia") at a temperature of sixty degrees Fahrenheit (60 F.). e. The word "Mcf" as used herein means one thousand (1000) cubic feet of gas. f. The words "gas" or "natural gas" as used herein mean any mixture of hydrocarbons or of hydrocarbons and non-combustible gas, in a gaseous state, consisting essentially of methane, and meeting the quality standards set forth herein. g. The word "Btu" as used herein means British Thermal Unit. h. The word "MMBtu" as used herein means one million British Thermal Units. i. The word "Agreement" as used herein means a written gas transportation agreement in the form provided by Transporter entered into between any Shipper and Transporter in the exercise of its authority pursuant to the Part 284.224 Blanket Certificate. j. The word "Shipper" as used herein means any eligible gas transportation customer which enters into an Agreement with Transporter. k. The word "firm" shall mean that Transporter shall not interrupt its performance except for reason of force majeure, as defined in Section 14 of this Statement, or non-performance by Shipper. l. The word "interruptible" shall mean that Transporter may interrupt its performance for any reason pursuant to the terms of this Statement. m. The word "Maximum Volume" as used herein means the maximum amount(s) of gas for receipt and delivery on a firm basis stated in Shipper's Agreement. 2. Firm, Interruptible Service Agreements Prior to providing firm or interruptible service pursuant to this Statement, Transporter shall be satisfied of each Shipper's financial solvency, based on reasonable standards of creditworthiness consistently applied. Transporter also shall be satisfied that the firm or interruptible service to be provided is authorized by its blanket certificate and the Commission's regulations applicable to such certificate. Firm service may include, if agreed to by Transporter, authorized service in excess of Shipper's Maximum Volume. Transporter shall render such transportation services pursuant to Agreements containing terms and conditions generally acceptable to Transporter, including those set forth herein, executed after consideration of its obligations to serve its gas distribution customers and its existing Part 284 firm customers (whether on-system or off-system), available pipeline capacity, points of receipt and points of delivery, and other factors deemed material by Transporter. 3. Requests for Transportation a. Transportation service provided under Transporter's Part 284.224 Blanket Certificate shall be made available on a non-discriminatory basis in order of the highest rates agreed to be paid (up to the maximum authorized rate) by any Shipper. In the event of any ties, requests for available service shall be granted on a pro rata basis as determined on the basis of requested contract delivery amounts; provided, however, that Transporter will accept as bona fide only those requests which, in Transporter's judgment, are sufficiently specific with respect to all material terms and conditions, including but not limited to: peak deliveries and annual usage; firm or interruptible service; receipt and delivery points; term; name and address of the applicant; the original source and location of the gas to be transported; and Shipper's arrangements for the delivery of such gas to and the receipt of such gas from Transporter or its designee by any necessary third-party transporter; and provided further that under no circumstances will Transporter be required to provide any requested Transportation service that would require the construction or acquisition of any new facilities by Transporter. b. Each Shipper's request for service hereunder shall be accompanied by a non-refundable processing fee in an amount to be determined by Transporter, which fee shall be applied to Shipper's first monthly statements from Transporter. At Transporter's option, Shipper may be required to provide evidence of creditworthiness, satisfactory to Transporter, prior to and as a condition of commencement of service. Transporter reserves the right to request, at any time prior to or during the rendition of service pursuant to the Agreement, that Shipper supply evidence of continuing creditworthiness. In the event Transporter determines, in its judgment, that Shipper is no longer creditworthy, Transporter may terminate its obligations to Shipper. 4. Transportation Rates, Charges, Fees The rate(s) for transportation services rendered by Transporter for Shipper shall be set forth in the Agreement. As set forth below in Section 20 - Statement of Rates - and modified from time to time pursuant to Part 284 of the Commission's regulations, rates for firm service shall consist of a reservation charge, a commodity charge, and to the extent applicable, a commodity charge for any volumes authorized in excess of Maximum Volume; and rates for interruptible service shall consist of a commodity charge. Rates will be stated in dollars per MMBtu. Rates, charges and fees will not exceed the maximums authorized pursuant to Transporter's blanket certificate or as established by any other governmental authority having jurisdiction. To the extent legally permissible, Transporter in addition may charge Shipper: a. For the costs of any facilities installed by Transporter to measure, receive or deliver natural gas for the account of Shipper; b. For any and all fees (including reporting fees) required in connection with the Agreement that Transporter is obligated to pay to the Commission or any other governmental authority having jurisdiction; c. For any natural gas gathering, occupation, production, severance or sales tax, first use tax, gross receipt tax, Btu tax or tax similar in nature or equivalent in effect that is now or hereafter imposed or assessed against Transporter by any lawful authority as a result of or in connection with the transportation of natural gas for Shipper; d. For the cost of gas required for fuel and line loss incurred by Transporter in providing transportation service, excluding the cost of any quantities for which fuel and line loss reimbursement has been received in kind by Transporter; and e. Any imbalance penalty reimbursement as provided in Section 8 hereof. 5. Governmental Regulation a. Service under this Statement must be interstate service eligible under, and shall be fully subject to, the applicable requirements of Section 284.224 of the Commission's rules and regulations, as they may be revised from time to time. Shipper's request for service, pursuant to Section 3 of this Statement, shall constitute its warranty that Shipper satisfies such requirements, and Transporter shall have the right to request information from Shipper to verify its eligibility. b. All of the provisions of this Statement are expressly made subject to all present and future applicable federal, state or local laws, regulations, rules and orders of governmental authorities having jurisdiction. Except as otherwise provided, in the event any provision of this Statement is found to be inconsistent with or contrary to any such federal, state or local laws, regulations, rules and orders, the latter shall be deemed to control and this Statement, to the extent possible, shall be deemed modified accordingly and as so modified shall continue in full force and effect. c. Shipper and Transporter recognize that Transporter has entered into transactions hereunder based on its good faith understanding that all acts, obligations and services performed or to be performed under this Statement and the charges therefore, are exempt from the Commission's regulation, except as otherwise provided by Section 284.224 of the Commission's rules and regulations. Performance by Transporter under each Agreement will be contingent upon the receipt of all necessary regulatory or other governmental approvals on terms satisfactory to both parties, and Transporter's obligations under the Agreement will terminate upon Transporter or Shipper being denied such approvals to provide the contemplated service or to construct and operate any necessary facilities upon the terms and conditions requested in any application for such authority. d. Transporter is a public utility subject to regulation by the Massachusetts Department of Public Utilities ("Department"). Compliance by Transporter with any order or rule of the Department or any other legislative or regulatory authority with jurisdiction shall not constitute a breach of any Agreement. 6. Receipt and Delivery Transporter is obligated by law to pursue a least cost gas purchase policy and to provide safe and adequate utility service to its gas distribution customers in its franchised service territory. Subject to Transporter's own operating requirements, as well as the availability of excess capacity in its existing facilities and other available facilities sufficient to provide transportation without impairing service to its distribution customers or its firm customers (whether on-system or off-system) and without violating its obligations under applicable law or its state-authorized tariff, transportation service will involve the receipt for Shipper's account at mutually agreeable point(s) of receipt ("Transporter Receipt Point(s)") of certain designated quantities of natural gas and the redelivery (on a concurrent or, if agreed to by Transporter, deferred basis) to Shipper or its designee at mutually agreeable point(s) of delivery ("Transporter Delivery Point(s)") of thermally equivalent quantities; provided, however, that Transporter may elect to retain a fuel and line loss allowance and, if so, Transporter shall reduce the delivered quantities by the amount of gas required by Transporter or its designee in providing transportation service. Transporter's obligations and responsibility are limited to the provision of transportation service on its distribution system and delivery to points of interconnection of its system to those of third-party interstate pipeline transporters of natural gas tendered by Shipper and received at Transporter Receipt Point(s). Shipper shall have the sole responsibility for making arrangements with third-party transporters for the receipt and transportation of thermally equivalent volumes delivered by Transporter to the Transporter Delivery Point(s). 7. Impairment of Receipts and Deliveries; Priority of Service If Transporter is unable to receive, transport and/or deliver, or cause the receipt, transportation and/or delivery of, to all Shippers on any day the total quantity of gas which Transporter is obligated under all Agreements to receive, transport and deliver to all Shippers on such day, Transporter will curtail service first to Shippers receiving interruptible service. Such curtailments will be implemented on a non-discriminatory basis in order of the rates agreed to be paid (lowest rate first, and so on, up to the maximum authorized rate) by each Shipper. In the event of any ties among such service, Transporter shall curtail services (from Shippers paying the same rate) pro rata on the basis of contract delivery amounts for the day the curtailment is in effect. Transporter shall not curtail firm service unless and until all interruptible services affected by the impairment of receipts and deliveries have been fully curtailed. If Transporter curtails firm service, Transporter shall do so pro rata on the basis of contract delivery amounts for the day the curtailment is in effect. To the extent a firm Shipper schedules amounts for transportation in excess of its stated Maximum Volume, any curtailment of those amounts will be accorded the same priority as Shippers receiving interruptible service. Transporter shall not be liable to any Shipper or to Shipper's customers for any loss or damage incurred by Shipper or its customers resulting from a reduction in transportation service by Transporter if, (i) such reduction is the result of capacity or facility constraints on Transporter's system beyond the control of Transporter which physically prevent deliveries for Shipper's account, including without limitation force majeure as defined in Section 14 of this Statement, and (ii) Transporter uses its best efforts to give Shipper six (6) hours notice of such reduction. Such reductions do not permit Transporter to use Shipper's gas for Transporter's system supply or use. Transporter shall use best efforts to avoid or minimize curtailments and shall cooperate with Shipper, to permit Shipper to the extent feasible to take actions within its control to avoid or minimize service reductions. 8. Determination and Balancing of Deliveries a. Shipper's dispatcher shall notify Transporter of the daily volumes of natural gas it nominates for transportation on any day at least 24 hours prior to the commencement of each day (hereinafter, "nomination"); provided, however, that such notice period will be no shorter than the notice required by a third-party interstate pipeline providing downstream transportation, unless Transporter agrees to a shorter notice period. In addition to providing such nomination, Shipper shall be responsible for notifying Transporter of any differences between its actual daily transportation volumes and its nominations. Unless otherwise agreed by Transporter, such nominations shall be in uniform daily quantities from day to day, and on any day, the quantities transported shall be equal to the quantity of gas actually received from Shipper (up to Shipper's nomination) less any fuel retention by Transporter. b. It is intended that on any given day natural gas received by Transporter at the Transporter Receipt Point(s) and natural gas delivered by Transporter at the Transporter Delivery Point(s) shall be thermally equivalent volumes of gas. However, from time to time, operating conditions and other factors may cause imbalances between Shipper's actual quantities delivered to Transporter and the quantities nominated for receipt and transport by Transporter. While Shipper and Transporter agree to cooperate to eliminate any such imbalances, Shipper shall rectify such imbalances within a mutually agreeable period of time by adjusting the nomination of daily quantities as provided in this section. Shipper shall reimburse Transporter in the event Transporter is assessed imbalance penalties by any third-party interstate pipeline transporter as a result of Shipper's imbalances. Such reimbursement shall be in addition to the rate charged by Transporter for service to Shipper hereunder. 9. Delivery Pressure All quantities of natural gas delivered by Shipper or for Shipper's account to Transporter or Transporter's designee at the Transporter Receipt Point(s) shall be at pressures sufficient to enter the pipeline facilities of Transporter or its designee receiving such gas against the line pressure existing in such facilities from time to time, but in no event shall the pressure of gas delivered by Shipper or for Shipper's account exceed the maximum allowable operating pressure at such point(s) of Transporter or its designee. Transporter shall not be obligated to lower or cause the lowering of such line pressure by compression or otherwise, and Shipper shall not compress such gas deliveries, or cause such gas deliveries to be compressed, without the prior written permission and approval of Transporter. All quantities of natural gas delivered by Transporter or its designee for Shipper's account at the Transporter Delivery Point(s) shall be made at the pressure existing from time to time in the facilities of Transporter or its designee delivering such gas. Transporter shall not be required to change its operating conditions or install or cause the installation of facilities, including compression, to enable the receipt or delivery of Shipper's gas. 10. Measurement The responsibility for measurement and metering at each Transporter Receipt and Delivery Point(s) shall be set forth in the Agreement. The amount or quantity of gas received and delivered under any Agreement hereunder at the applicable Transporter Receipt and Delivery Point(s) will be determined by the party responsible for measurement at each such point at a temperature of sixty degrees Fahrenheit (60 F.), at a pressure of 14.73 psia and on the basis of AGA Gas Measurement Committee Report No. Three, including any amendments or revisions thereof. 11. Measurement Equipment Transporter will install, operate and maintain or cause to be installed, operated and maintained such measuring and related facilities as are necessary for the measurement, in MMBtu (unless other units agreed upon by parties in an Agreement), of gas delivered at the Transporter Receipt Point(s) and at the Transporter Delivery Point(s); provided, however, that Shipper shall reimburse Transporter for any and all costs incurred by Transporter in connection with the installation of such facilities. If, upon test, any measuring equipment for measuring LNG (including, without limitation, recording calorimeters) is found to be in error not more than two percent (2%), previous recordings of such equipment shall be considered accurate in computing deliveries hereunder but such equipment shall be adjusted at once to record correctly. If, upon test, (1) measuring equipment shall be found to be inaccurate by an amount exceeding two percent (2%), at a recording corresponding to the average hourly rate of flow while recording for the period since the last preceding test, or (2) a recording calorimeter shall be found to be inaccurate by an amount exceeding two percent (2%), then any previous recordings of such equipment shall be corrected to zero error for any period which is definitely known or agreed upon by Shipper and Boston Gas. For any period prior to a test finding inaccuracies as described in (1) and (2) in the preceding sentence, but which period is not known or agreed upon by Shipper and Boston Gas, correction to zero shall be made for a period equal to one-half of the time elapsed since the date of the last test, not to exceed a correction period of 16 days. 12. Quality Gas tendered for transportation shall be of merchantable quality and shall meet or exceed the quality specifications of the interstate pipeline transporting such gas. 13. Billing and Payment a. Transporter shall render a statement setting forth the total daily quantities of gas, in MMBtu, received and tendered or caused to be tendered to Shipper or for its account by Transporter or its designee at the Transporter Delivery Point(s) during the immediately preceding month, and the amount payable therefor. The full amount payable according to such statement shall be paid not more than ten (10) days after the date of said statement. Failure to pay the amount of any bill when such amount is due shall result in a late payment charge in accordance with Transporter's Terms and Conditions of Gas Service on file with the Department. If such failure to pay continues for thirty (30) days after payment is due, Transporter, in addition to any other remedy it may have, may suspend further transportation of gas until such amount is paid. b. Transporter and Shipper or the representatives of each shall have the right at all reasonable times to examine the books and records of the other party to the extent necessary to verify the accuracy of any statement, charge, computation or demand made under or pursuant to the Agreement. Any statement shall be final unless questioned within one (1) year after the date thereof. 14. Force Majeure In the event that either Transporter or Shipper is rendered unable by reason of an event of force majeure to perform, in whole or in part, any obligation or commitment set forth in this Statement, then upon such party giving notice and full particulars of such event as soon as practicable, by telephone followed by written confirmation, after the occurrence of the event, the obligations of both parties, except for unpaid financial obligations arising prior to such event of force majeure, shall be suspended to the extent and for the period of such force majeure condition. The term "force majeure" as used in this Statement shall mean any causes not due to the fault of the party claiming force majeure beyond such party's reasonable control, including acts of God or a public enemy, strikes, riots, injunctions, or other interference through legal proceeding, emergency or otherwise unexpected non-routine repairs or maintenance activities, breakage or accident to machinery or pipelines, interruptions or failures of any upstream or downstream pipelines relied upon to effectuate any service under this Statement, washouts, earthquakes, storms, freezing of lines or wells, blowouts, or the compliance with applicable federal, state or local laws, regulations, rules and orders of governmental authorities having jurisdiction when such governmental action pertains to matters which are not reasonably in Transporter's control and is unexpected. The term "force majeure" shall not include (a) the failure or inability to obtain Gas; (b) for firm transportation service, the curtailment or interruption of interruptible transportation by Shipper's upstream or downstream transporter; (c) the loss of Shipper's markets or Shipper's inability economically to use or resell gas to be received by it under an Agreement; or (d) Transporter's ability to sell service to another Shipper at a more advantageous price. Neither Transporter nor Shipper shall be entitled to the benefit of the provisions of this Section 14 to the extent that the failure was caused by the party claiming suspension having failed to remedy the condition by taking all reasonable acts or having failed to resume performance of such commitments or obligations with all reasonable dispatch. Nothing in this paragraph shall require a party to engage in litigation to remedy an event of force majeure. Settlement of strikes and lockouts shall be entirely within the discretion of the affected party. The requirement that any event of force majeure be remedied with all reasonable dispatch shall not require the settlement of strikes and lockouts by acceding to the demands of those directly or indirectly involved in such strikes or lockouts. 15. Possession of Gas, Title and Responsibility a. As between Shipper and Transporter, Transporter shall be deemed to be in control and possession of the gas to be transported under the Agreement from the Transporter Receipt Point(s) to the Transporter Delivery Point(s), after which Shipper shall be deemed to be in control and possession thereof. Shipper shall have no responsibility on account of anything which may be done, happen or arise with respect to the gas between the Receipt Point and the Delivery Point, and Transporter shall have no responsibility for anything which may be done, happen or arise with respect to the gas before such Receipt Point or after it passes such Delivery Point. b. Shipper represents and warrants for itself and its successors that at the time of receipt by Transporter of gas to be transported for Shipper's account under the Agreement, Shipper will have good title, or right to such title, to all such gas so delivered, free of all liens, encumbrances and claims whatsoever. Shipper will indemnify Transporter and hold it harmless from all suits, actions, debts, accounts, damages, costs, losses and expenses arising from or out of any adverse claims of any and all persons to or against said gas. 16. Conditions Precedent In the event that on or before sixty (60) days subsequent to the date of any Agreement deliveries of gas for transportation thereunder have not commenced, then in such event and thereafter, until such deliveries are tendered and accepted, either party may cancel such Agreement by giving written notice of such cancellation to the other party. Transporter shall be under no obligation to commence service under any Agreement unless and until (i) all facilities, of whatever nature, as are required to permit the receipt, measurement, transportation and delivery of natural gas thereunder have been installed and are in operating condition, and (ii) Shipper has arranged for the delivery of such gas to and the receipt of such gas from Transporter or its designee by any necessary third-party transporter. 17. Notices Any notice, request, demand, statement, bill or payment which Transporter may desire to give to Shipper shall be in writing and shall be considered as duly delivered when mailed to Shipper at the address specified in the applicable Agreement. Any notice, request, demand, payment and other communication which Shipper may desire to give to Transporter shall be in writing and shall be considered as duly delivered when delivered by hand, certified mail, facsimile or electronic mail to Transporter. Operating communications may be made by telephone or other mutually agreeable means but must be confirmed in writing upon request by Transporter to be considered as duly delivered. 18. Confidentiality Unless otherwise agreed by Transporter, the Shipper-specific terms contained in any Agreement or nomination form shall be kept confidential by the parties except to the extent disclosure is required by law, in which event the party obligated to disclose will endeavor to cause such terms to be treated as confidential trade secrets or proprietary information and shall notify the other party of such disclosure. 19. Miscellaneous a. Successors and Assigns. Each Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the successors, assigns and legal representatives of the parties; provided, however, that neither party thereto shall assign the Agreement or any portion thereof, or any of its rights and obligations thereunder, without first securing the prior written consent of the other party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld. Any entity which shall succeed by purchase, merger, consolidation or otherwise to the properties substantially as an entirety, of Transporter or Shipper, used or intended to be used for rendering gas service authorized by the Commission, shall be entitled to the rights, and shall be subject to the obligations, of its predecessors in title under a Service Agreement. b. Waiver. A waiver by either party of any one or more defaults by the other in the performance of any provisions of an Agreement shall not operate as a waiver of any future default or defaults, whether of a like or different character. c. Entire Agreement. Each Agreement contains the entire agreement between the parties, and except as stated in the Agreement, there are not promises, agreements, warranties, obligations, assurances, or conditions precedent or otherwise affecting it. d. Written Modification. Any change, modification, or alteration of an Agreement shall be in writing, signed by the parties to an Agreement, and no course of dealing or course of performance between the parties shall be construed to alter the terms of any Agreement. e. Headings. The captions and headings in this Statement and in any Agreement are inserted for convenience of reference only and shall not affect the construction or interpretation of the Statement or the Agreement. f. No Third Party Beneficiary. Transporter and Shipper agree that there is no third party beneficiary of any Agreement and that the provisions of an Agreement do not impart enforceable rights to anyone who is not a party. g. Governing Law and Forum. The Agreements shall be interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of Massachusetts, without regard to conflict of law principles. The forum of any litigation shall be before the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or in a state or federal court located in Massachusetts. h. Limitation on Liability. In no event shall Transporter or Shipper be liable to the other for consequential, indirect, special, punitive or exemplary damages arising out of service provided under this Statement. i. Assignment of Administrative Duties. Transporter reserves the right at any time to assign or otherwise delegate to any independent third party or a duly authorized agent any or all of the administrative duties associated with the services provided pursuant to this Statement. No such delegation shall relieve Transporter of its obligations to Shipper. 20. Statement of Rates The currently effective rates for transportation service under Transporter's Part 284.224 Blanket Certificate are provided in Table 1 below.
